channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Amazon tells employees to return to office five days a week
item.description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy is instructing corporate staffers to work out of the office five days a week.

item.title: Intel stock jumps on plan to turn foundry business into subsidiary and allow for outside funding
item.description: Intel said it's turning its foundry business into an independent unit with its own board and the potential to raise outside capital.

item.title: China's economy is going through a 'slow, painful, grinding adjustment,' analyst says
item.description: Beijing's economic outlook for the second half of the year is now "flashing red, or pretty close to red," said Eswar Prasad, professor of international trade and economics at Cornell University.

item.title: It's a big week for central banks around the world, with a slew of rate moves on the table
item.description: The Federal Reserve's highly anticipated two-day meeting, which gets underway on Tuesday, is poised to take center stage.

item.title: Drugmakers bet billions that targeted radiation could become the next cancer breakthrough
item.description: Bristol Myers Squibb, AstraZeneca, Eli Lilly and other drug companies have invested some $10 billion on promising cancer technology behind Novartis' Pluvicto.

item.title: India can achieve sustainable growth of up to 8% in the coming years, central bank chief says
item.description: India can achieve sustainable economic growth of up to 8% over the medium term, according to the country's central bank governor.

item.title: Suspect in apparent Trump assassination attempt charged with two gun crimes, appears in court
item.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump narrowly survived a prior assassination attempt at a campaign rally two months earlier.

item.title: FDA clears Apple's sleep apnea detection feature for use. Here's how it works
item.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday cleared Apple's new sleep apnea detection feature for use.

item.title: Apple iOS 18 update is live: These are the most important new iPhone security features to protect your private life
item.description: Apple iOS 18 released Monday and while iPhone 16 received most of the recent attention, it is one of the most significant updates for user privacy and security.

item.title: European markets close lower as bumper week for central banks kick off
item.description: European stocks closed lower as investors prepared for a bumper week of rate decisions from the U.S Federal Reserve and the Bank of England.

item.title: Trump safe, suspect in custody as FBI investigates apparent 'attempted assassination'
item.description: U.S. Secret Service officers fired shots at a gunman located near the property line of Donald Trump's golf course in Florida.

item.title: Pictures show floods ravaging Central and Eastern Europe as death toll rises
item.description: Floods brought on by days of heavy rainfalls have been ravaging several European countries, with thousands of people being evacuated the the death toll rising.

item.title: Trump 'assassination attempt' unleashes flood of misinformation on Chinese social media
item.description: An apparent assassination attempt on Donald Trump has garnered mass attention from Chinese citizens, including conspiracy theories and criticism of U.S. politics.

item.title: India's Bajaj Housing Finance sees shares more than double on debut after stellar IPO
item.description: The company's shares surged to as much as 161 rupees apiece, jumping about 130% from the top end of its IPO pricing of 70 rupees.

item.title: The Fed has the proof it wants that inflation is slowing, but the next move is still up in the air
item.description: A week's worth of inflation data showed that price pressures have eased substantially.

item.title: China's local government debt problems are a hidden drag on economic growth
item.description: China's persistent consumption slowdown traces back to the country's real estate slump, and its deep ties to local government finances — and debt.

item.title: Pfizer says its experimental drug for deadly condition that causes appetite and weight loss in cancer patients shows positive trial results
item.description: The results could pave the way for Pfizer's drug ponsegromab to become the first-ever approved treatment specifically for cancer cachexia.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: After the Fed’s first cut, where to next?
item.description: What many are not discussing is the policy trajectory after the Fed's meeting. Following this cut could be a trajectory that will change the market narrative.

item.title: China raising its retirement age may be unpopular but it's much needed, analysts say
item.description: Economists have long called for an overhaul of the nation's retirement age laws, currently among the world's lowest, that was set in an era with lower life expectancies.

item.title: Why the European Union's tariffs on Chinese automakers may not work
item.description: Supporters say EU tariffs on Chinese EVs will offset harm of Chinese subsidies. Critics say they will slow EV adoption and hurt some European carmakers.

item.title: DirecTV, Disney reach deal to end blackout in time for college football
item.description: Disney and DirecTV have reached a deal to end a blackout in time for college football this weekend.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts pick these dividend stocks for attractive returns
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service pinpoints Wall Street's best-performing stocks, including McDonald's and Chord Energy

item.title: Trump says 'I hate Taylor Swift' after pop star endorses Kamala Harris
item.description: Trump's post follows Swift's Sept. 10 endorsement of Harris, shortly after the presidential debate between the two major party candidates.

item.title: Boeing warns strike will 'jeopardize' recovery, hurt aircraft production
item.description: Brian West said the financial impact of the strike will depend on how long it lasts, but it will affect the company's production of its best-selling planes.

item.title: Voss Capital wants to maximize shareholder value at International Money Express. How it may play out
item.description: The firm is a long-term investor at the money remittance services provider.

item.title: Shein and Temu prices are set to get a lot higher as Biden takes aim at retailers linked to China
item.description: Critics say Shein and Temu are able to offer low prices because they evade import duties under the de minimis exemption — a loophole that could soon be closed.

item.title: Brazil supreme court unfreezes assets of Elon Musk's Starlink, X after taking fines
item.description: Brazil's supreme court announced that it ordered funds be moved from Starlink and X bank accounts to pay for fines levied against Elon Musk's social network.

item.title: Biden targets Shein, Temu with new rules to curb alleged 'abuse' of U.S. trade loophole
item.description: Under a new White House rule proposal, Chinese exports subject to U.S. tariffs would no longer be eligible for the de minimis shipping loophole.

item.title: Most Gen Z Brits want to 'be their own boss' — but one expert says they'll face a reality check
item.description: The vast majority of Gen Z want to "be their own boss," and have no intentions of working a 9-to-5 job, a new Santander survey finds.

item.title: DJT shares soar as Trump says 'I'm not selling' stake
item.description: Donald Trump, the majority owner of Trump Media stock, is eligible to sell his DJT shares later this month.
